trans-unit.source: Use a script to customize your build process
trans-unit.target: Use a script to customize your build process

trans-unit.source: When you are ready to move beyond the basics of compiling and testing your code, use a script to add your team's business logic to your build process.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready to move beyond the basics of compiling and testing your code, use a script to add your team's business logic to your build process.

trans-unit.source: Run a PowerShell script
trans-unit.target: Run a PowerShell script

trans-unit.source: You can run a PowerShell Script on a <linkText>Windows build agent</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can run a PowerShell Script on a <linkText>Windows build agent</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Push your script into your repo.
trans-unit.target: Push your script into your repo.

trans-unit.source: Add a PowerShell build step.
trans-unit.target: Add a PowerShell build step.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add step</linkText> <linkText>Add PowerShell step</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add step</linkText> <linkText>Add PowerShell step</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Drag the build step where you want it to run.
trans-unit.target: Drag the build step where you want it to run.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the script.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the script.

trans-unit.source: Example: Version your assemblies
trans-unit.target: Example: Version your assemblies

trans-unit.source: For example, to version to your assemblies, copy and upload this script to your team project:
trans-unit.target: For example, to version to your assemblies, copy and upload this script to your team project:

trans-unit.source: Add the build step to your build definition.
trans-unit.target: Add the build step to your build definition.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Apply version to assemblies build step</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Apply version to assemblies build step</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify your build number with something like this:
trans-unit.target: Specify your build number with something like this:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Build number format</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Build number format</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Q&A
trans-unit.target: Q&A

trans-unit.source: What variables are available for me to use in my scripts?
trans-unit.target: What variables are available for me to use in my scripts?

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Predefined variables you can use in your scripts</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Predefined variables you can use in your scripts</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Which branch of the script does the build run?
trans-unit.target: Which branch of the script does the build run?

trans-unit.source: The build runs the script same branch of the code you are building.
trans-unit.target: The build runs the script same branch of the code you are building.

trans-unit.source: What kinds of parameters can I use?
trans-unit.target: What kinds of parameters can I use?

trans-unit.source: You can use named parameters.
trans-unit.target: You can use named parameters.

trans-unit.source: Other kinds of parameters, such as switch parameters, are not yet supported and will cause errors.
trans-unit.target: Other kinds of parameters, such as switch parameters, are not yet supported and will cause errors.
